articles.title: Colin Farrell Recalls ‘Minority Report’ Scene That Took 46 Takes While Drunk, Tom Cruise “Wasn’t Very Happy” - Deadline
articles.description: Tom Cruise could see into the future in 'Minority Report', but co-star Colin Farrell might have benefitted from some foresight while making the movie.

articles.title: Kid Rock gets 'urgent request' from Special Olympics after using slur to describe his Halloween costume - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: The Special Olympics has responded to Kid Rock's use of the r-word on Fox News last week.

articles.title: ‘Hello Kitty’ Movie Sets July 2028 Release Date From Warner Bros. - Variety
articles.description: After several years in development, Warner Bros. is finally moving ahead with the "Hello Kitty" animated feature, dating it for July 21, 2028.

articles.title: Maria Riva, Actress and Daughter of Marlene Dietrich, Dies at 100 - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: She appeared in films as a child with her mom before becoming a great star for CBS in the early days of television.

articles.title: Howie Rose not pleased with Sandy Koufax sitting behind Prince Harry, Meghan Markle at World Series - New York Post
articles.description: Some baseball fans weren’t happy to see Prince Harry and Meghan Markle getting the royal treatment at Dodger Stadium over MLB royalty during Game 4 of the World Series.

articles.title: Their love is no longer blind: Why some fans say they've soured on Netflix's dating show - NBC News
articles.description: Not one couple who met during season nine of “Love Is Blind” had a fairy-tale ending, a shocking conclusion that has made some fans question whether the dating show is worth their time.

articles.title: Pierre Robert, Philadelphia’s Voice of Rock Radio, Dead at 70 - Rolling Stone
articles.description: Pierre Robert, the voice of Philadelphia rock radio for decades, has died at age 70.

articles.title: ‘IT: Welcome to Derry’ Creators On Deciding To “Trick The Audience” With Pilot Twist: “Nothing Is Safe” - Deadline
articles.description: As one of Stephen King's scariest pieces of IP gets the HBO Max series treatment, the bloodbath has commenced with the first episode.

articles.title: MPs raise concerns over Prince Andrew's Royal Lodge lease - BBC
articles.description: Parliamentary committee demands answers about whether the lease arrangements are "achieving the best value for money".

articles.title: Sydney Sweeney stuns in World Series snaps: ‘Couple of Dodger dogs’ - New York Post
articles.description: Sydney Sweeny enjoyed the refreshments at Dodger Stadium on Tuesday night.

articles.title: Long Live Claude Whelan, Slow Horses’s Finest Failure - Vulture
articles.description: The thing that makes ‘Slow Horses’ work so well is that everyone on this show is incompetent in their own little way. But Claude Whelan’s personal brand of incompetence in season five was something special.

articles.title: ‘The View’ Won’t Wear Halloween Costumes Because They Can’t ‘Talk About the Middle East While Dressed as Little Orphan Annie’ | Video - Yahoo News Canada
articles.description: Executive producer Brian Teta admits that the ABC talk show's hosts wouldn't be able to "talk about the Middle East" dressed up.

articles.title: Tess Holliday Says a United Flight Attendant Fat-Shamed Her, Told Her to ‘Lose Weight’ - TooFab
articles.description: After her hip accidentally hit the call button in an airplane restroom, Tess Holliday says a United Airlines flight attendant showed up and lectured her for 10 minutes, saying she "needed to lose weight" and that her size was bad for her long-term health.

articles.title: ‘The White Lotus’ to Shoot Season 4 in Paris and the French Riviera at Five-Star Hotels (EXCLUSIVE) - variety.com
articles.description: Mike White's hit anthology series has been actively scouting swank locations in two iconic locations, Paris and the French Riviera, for Season 4.

articles.title: First Predator: Badlands Reactions Have Critics United - SlashFilm
articles.description: Prey director Dan Trachtenberg is back with another Predator film, Predator: Badlands, and early critic reactions bode well for this unconventional follow-up.

articles.title: Diane Lane was 'overwhelmed' filming with her 'hot' young 'Outsiders' costars: 'Too much testosterone' - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: Diane Lane says she was 'definitely overwhelmed' while shooting 1983's 'The Outsiders' with her 'hot' young costars Matt Dillon, Rob Lowe, Tom Cruise, Ralph Macchio, and Patrick Swayze: 'Too much testosterone for one girl.'

articles.title: Rosie O’Donnell’s daughter, Chelsea, to serve prison time - WSB-TV
articles.description: Former talk show host Rosie O’Donnell is asking for prayers after her daughter, Chelsea O’Donnell, had her probation revoked and will have to serve time behind bars.

articles.title: Drake Files Appeal to Revive Defamation Case Over Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’ - Billboard
articles.description: Drake files an appeal in his lawsuit over Kendrick Lamar’s diss track “Not Like Us," seeking to reverse a ruling that dismissed the case against UMG.

articles.title: No rap songs are on the Billboard Top 40 for the first time in 35 years - The Fader
articles.description: The Billboard Hot 100 has no rap songs in the top 40 for the first time in 35 years after Kendrick Lamar and SZA's "luther" was removed under new rules.
